summary: Electric Light Orchestra (ELO) is an English rock band formed in 1970 by Jeff Lynne, Roy Wood, and Bev Bevan. They mixed pop and classical music with futuristic themes. After Wood left in 1972, Lynne led the band, writing most songs. ELO had many hit albums and singles in the 1970s and 1980s, like "Out of the Blue" and "Discovery." They sold over 50 million records and were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2017. The band broke up in 1986 but reformed later. Recently, they announced a final tour after the death of member Richard Tandy.
title: Electric Light Orchestra
